activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelo Patrick Callegari

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Waiver of preliminary hearing
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:09 AM Defendant Angelo Patrick Callegari appeared by video.  Attorney Richard Russell McCue Jr appeared by video for Angelo Patrick Callegari.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Remand to branch 2 for scheduling of arraignment within 30 days per request of attorney McCue.
Waiver of Prelim on October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

1:12 PM Defendant Angelo Patrick Callegari not in court.  Attorney Richard Russell McCue Jr appeared by video for Angelo Patrick Callegari.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney McCue asks for matter to be continued for a waiver of preliminary hearing.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:58 AM Defendant Angelo Patrick Callegari appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Court orders $1000 signature bond to be signed by September 30, 2022 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim A.E., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No signing of any document for anyone else. Adjourned initial appearance set or October 12, 2022 at 1:00 PM
